page.title: 20PLAYGROUND GAMES
page.content: In Primaries 1 and 2 (five/six years) the most popular games are imaginative games such as mummies and daddies and super babies, which is a game where girls pretend that they are super babies and catch the boys who are the baddies. They play ordinary games as well like tig. Primary 4's usually play football and rounders. In Primary 5 they play soldiers and tig and sometimes they play 'chainy' where someone is 'hit', they have to catch someone else who joins up and they catch another and so on. In Primaries 6 and 7 they play games like football (both girls and boys) and helpy which is another kind of tig. They play hide and seek as well. In the summer the girls play skipping and practise headstands against the school wall.
